item.title: 纳斯达克期货领涨，因 AMD 在美联储裁决前提振芯片；微软下跌
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）的看涨预测提振了苦苦挣扎的芯片股，而微软公司在美国关键的利率决定前逆势上涨，纳斯达克期货周三跳涨逾 1%。【原文：Nasdaq futures jumped more than 1% on Wednesday after a bullish forecast from Advanced Micro Devices bolstered struggling chip stocks, while Microsoft bucked the positive trend in megacaps ahead of a key U.S. interest-rate decision.】

item.title: 香港法院延期中国开发商世茂的清盘申请
item.description: 陷入困境的中国房地产开发商世茂集团周三表示，香港一家法院已将针对该公司的清算听证会延期至8月12日，使其有更多时间与债权人就修订后的重组方案进行合作。【原文：Embattled Chinese property developer Shimao Group said on Wednesday a Hong Kong court had adjourned until Aug. 12 a liquidation hearing against the company, allowing it more time to work with creditors on a revised restructuring proposal.】

item.title: 双线敲响美国政府债务螺旋式上升的警钟
item.description: 投资公司DoubleLine的一位分析师表示，未来10年美国债务支付的增加和经济衰退的可能性可能会使美国的债务水平超出最近的预测，并对经济增长造成压力。【原文：Higher debt payments and the possibility of a U.S. recession over the next 10 years could boost U.S. debt levels beyond recent forecasts and weigh on economic growth, an analyst at investment firm DoubleLine said.】

item.title: 早间竞价：日本央行加息、美联储加息、大科技公司失利
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 杜邦上调全年预期，因电子产品和人工智能技术需求强劲
item.description: 工业材料制造商杜邦公司（DuPont de Nemours）周三上调了全年业绩预期，得益于电子产品和人工智能技术的强劲需求，该公司第二季度业绩超预期。【原文：Industrial materials maker DuPont de Nemours raised full-year forecasts on Wednesday, benefiting from strong demand for electronics and artificial intelligence-based technology that helped it beat second-quarter results.】

item.title: 美国供应商豪迈特因空客发动机延误而备受关注
item.description: 法国喷气发动机制造商赛峰集团（Safran）周三指认美国承包商豪迈宇航公司（Howmet Aerospace）为零件供应商，该公司是导致发动机生产放缓和空客喷气机交付缩减的工业问题的核心。【原文：French jet engine maker Safran on Wednesday named U.S. contractor Howmet Aerospace as the supplier of parts at the centre of industrial issues that led to a slowdown of engine production and curtailed deliveries of Airbus jets.】

item.title: 美国信贷条件趋紧或有助于为美联储降息铺平道路
item.description: 除了通胀数据向好和就业市场降温之外，以贷款需求不振和贷款条件苛刻为特点的美国信贷条件也可能增强美联储官员的信心，即物价压力将进一步缓解，从而为未来几个月的降息铺平道路。【原文：Benign inflation data and a cooling job market aside, U.S. credit conditions featuring tepid loan demand and stiff terms may also be bolstering confidence among Federal Reserve officials that price pressures are set to ease further, paving the way for interest rate cuts in coming months.】

item.title: 独家报道花旗银行违反旨在保护银行安全的规定，报告流动性错误
item.description: 路透社看到的一份花旗集团 12 月份的文件显示，花旗集团多次违反美国联邦储备委员会限制公司间交易的规定，导致其内部流动性报告出现错误。【原文：Citigroup repeatedly breached a U.S. Federal Reserve rule that limits intercompany transactions, leading to errors in its internal liquidity reporting, according to a Citi document from December seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 加密货币玩家为特朗普可能的第二届政府准备好了愿望清单
item.description: 当美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普周六在一个比特币会议上承诺，如果连任，他将解雇对加密货币持怀疑态度的美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）时，全场发出了热烈的欢呼声。【原文：When former U.S. president Donald Trump promised a bitcoin conference on Saturday that if reelected he would fire Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler, a crypto skeptic, the crowd roared with delight.】

item.title: 美联储有望维持利率稳定，为 9 月降息敞开大门
item.description: 预计美联储将在周三结束为期两天的政策会议时维持利率不变，但也表示借贷成本最快可能在 9 月份下调。【原文：The Federal Reserve is expected to leave interest rates unchanged at the end of a two-day policy meeting on Wednesday, but also indicate that a reduction in borrowing costs could come as soon as September.】

item.title: ASML股价上涨，有望在下一轮中美芯片之争中幸免于难
item.description: 路透社的一篇报道暗示，正在审议的中美新出口限制措施将使最大的计算机芯片生产设备制造商阿斯麦公司（ASML）首当其冲，该公司股价周三大涨。【原文：Shares in ASML , the largest maker of equipment used to manufacture computer chips, jumped on Wednesday following a Reuters report that implied it will be spared the brunt of new U.S.-China export restrictions under consideration.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司第一季度利润下降
item.description: 新加坡航空公司周三公布，受收益率下降和燃油成本上升的影响，第一季度净利润下降了38.4%。【原文：Singapore Airlines reported a 38.4% fall in first-quarter net profit on Wednesday, hurt by lower yields and a rise in fuel costs.】

item.title: 中国特穆商贩抗议处罚政策
item.description: 参与抗议的一位商家告诉路透社记者，数百名中国卖家在特姆优上抗议该公司施加的难以忍受的高额罚款，这是与低成本竞争对手Shein进行激烈价格竞争的一个新迹象。【原文：Hundreds of Chinese sellers on Temu have protested against what they call unbearably high penalties imposed by the firm, one of the merchants involved in the protest told Reuters, a fresh sign of tough price competition with low-cost rival Shein.】

item.title: 欧洲股市高开 1%，因 ASML 盈利提振
item.description: 周三，欧洲股市攀升近 1%，主要是受到一系列企业最新消息的推动，而重磅股 ASML 则引领了整体涨势，因为有报道称这家荷兰芯片设备制造商不受美国关于外国芯片设备出口的新规定的限制。【原文：European shares climbed nearly 1% on Wednesday, driven by a raft of corporate updates, while heavyweight ASML led overall gains on report that the Dutch chip equipment manufacturer was exempt from a fresh U.S. rule on foreign chip equipment exports.】

item.title: 随着奢侈品行业的衰退，雨果-博斯（Hugo Boss）可能会推迟 2025 年的目标
item.description: 雨果博斯（Hugo Boss）周四公布第二季度业绩报告时，可能会将主要销售和利润目标推迟到 2025 年以后，因为投资者正在关注有关贸易和成本削减计划的最新情况。【原文：Hugo Boss may push back key sales and profit targets beyond 2025 when it reports its second-quarter results on Thursday, as investors watch for updates on trading and cost-cutting plans.】

item.title: 日本结束通货紧缩，瑞穗第一季度盈利增长 17.9
item.description: 日本资产排名第三的瑞穗金融集团（Mizuho Financial Group）周三公布第一季度利润增长 17.9%，原因是期待已久的负利率结束提高了贷款利润率。【原文：Japan's third-largest lender by assets, Mizuho Financial Group , reported 17.9% growth in first-quarter profit on Wednesday as the long-awaited end of negative interest rates lifted profit margins on lending.】

item.title: 法国威立雅公司将出售北美硫酸再生业务
item.description: 法国威立雅集团表示，已同意将其在北美的硫酸再生业务出售给私募股权公司 American Industrial Partners，企业价值（EV）为 6.2 亿美元。【原文：French group Veolia said it had agreed to sell its sulfuric acid regeneration business in North America to private equity firm American Industrial Partners for an enterprise value (EV) of $620 million.】

item.title: 日本央行加息，日本收益率刷新 15 年高点，银行股大涨
item.description: 周三，日本短期国债收益率攀上 15 年高位，日本银行股价飙升，原因是日本央行自 2007 年以来仅第二次加息，同时宣布将每月购债规模减半。【原文：Short-term Japanese government bond yields scaled 15-year peaks and Japanese bank shares soared on Wednesday as the Bank of Japan raised interest rates for only the second time since 2007 while announcing a halving of its monthly bond buying.】

item.title: 令人失望的更新后，微软股价在法兰克福下跌
item.description: 在发布了令人失望的最新消息后，微软在法兰克福上市的股票在周三开盘时下跌了 2.7%。【原文：Microsoft's Frankfurt-listed shares fell 2.7% at the open on Wednesday following a disappointing update.】

item.title: Just Eat 外卖店宣布回购，欧洲市场带动利润增长
item.description: Just Eat 外卖公司周三报告称，在其主要欧洲市场的带动下，上半年核心利润猛增 40%以上，并宣布了一项股票回购计划，还表示将致力于利用技术进一步削减成本。【原文：Just Eat Takeaway reported a more than 40% jump in first-half core profit on Wednesday, led by its main European markets, announced a share buyback programme and said it was focused on using technology to cut costs further.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯称第二季度北美基本销售额增长
item.description: 阿迪达斯周三表示，受批发和自有零售业务增长的推动，不包括 Yeezy 系列销售在内的北美市场第二季度收入比去年同期有所增长。【原文：Adidas said on Wednesday its second-quarter revenues in North America, excluding sales of the Yeezy line, increased from last year, driven by growth in both wholesale and its own retail.】

item.title: 丰田第一季度利润增长得益于混合动力需求，但增长势头可能放缓
item.description: 本周四，日本丰田汽车公司将公布财报，混合动力车的需求可能会使该公司在另一个季度实现两位数的增长，尽管在连续创下利润新高之后，预计该公司的增长速度将出现放缓迹象。【原文：Demand for hybrids is likely to deliver another quarter of double-digit growth for Japan's Toyota Motor when it reports earnings on Thursday, although it is expected to show signs of slowing after a run of record profits.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称美国对华出口外国芯片设备新规将豁免部分盟国
item.description: 两位熟悉该规则的消息人士称，拜登政府计划在下个月公布一项新规则，扩大美国阻止某些外国半导体制造设备向中国芯片制造商出口的权力。【原文：The Biden administration plans to unveil a new rule next month that will expand U.S. powers to stop exports of semiconductor manufacturing equipment from some foreign countries to Chinese chipmakers, two sources familiar with the rule said.】

item.title: 法国赛峰集团上半年利润增长
item.description: 喷气发动机和设备制造商赛峰集团周三公布了上半年利润增长情况，重申了财务目标，这主要得益于现有飞机备件和维修需求的增长以及飞机内饰亏损的结束。【原文：Jet engine and equipment maker Safran reaffirmed financial targets as it posted higher first-half profit on Wednesday, led by growth in the demand for spares and maintenance for existing aircraft and an end to losses in aircraft interiors.】

item.title: 汉莎航空预计第三季度盈利下滑，原因是成本上升
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司（Lufthansa）周三表示，由于收益率下滑和单位成本上升，该公司预计第三季度盈利将下降。【原文：German flag carrier Lufthansa expects lower earnings in the third quarter as yields slump and unit costs increase, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲 日本央行加息，美联储下一步行动
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 投资者对日本央行加息的反应
item.description: 日本央行周三表示，将把短期利率上调至 0.25%，并将逐步减少在量化宽松计划下购买的债券数量。【原文：The Bank of Japan said on Wednesday it is raising its short-term interest rate to 0.25% and will gradually reduce the amount of bonds it is buying under its quantitative easing programme.】

item.title: 汇丰银行上半年利润持平，但好于预期
item.description: 汇丰控股周三公布的上半年利润微降 0.4%，但仍超出分析师预期，原因是其业务受益于全球利率上升，同时财富业务的强劲增长也提高了收入。【原文：HSBC Holdings reported a slight decline of 0.4% in first-half profit on Wednesday but still beat analyst estimates, as its businesses benefited from higher interest rates worldwide while robust growth in its wealth business boosted revenue.】

item.title: 日本央行提高利率，提出债券缩减计划
item.description: 日本央行周三提高了利率，并预计未来几年通胀率将保持在2%的目标附近，这表明日本央行决心稳步解除十年来的大规模货币刺激政策。【原文：The Bank of Japan raised interest rates on Wednesday and projected inflation to stay around its 2% target in coming years, signaling its resolve to steadily unwind a decade of massive monetary stimulus.】

item.title: 电装将全年营业利润预期下调 3.1%
item.description: 丰田汽车的主要供应商日本电装公司（Denso）公布的第一季度利润基本符合分析师预期，但该公司周三将全年营业利润预期下调了 3.1%。【原文：Japan's Denso , a leading supplier to Toyota , reduced its full-year operating profit forecast by 3.1% on Wednesday after reporting first-quarter profit that was largely in line with analysts' expectations.】
